author: andreas
content: One second, with concentration and some luck, I guess that's the maximum. Today I tried another garage shot, this time it was 1.3 s, but I couldn't hold it at all. Anyway. With the DSLR, 1/4 s is the maximum that I can use with similar (im)probability of success. Which ever way you look at it, I see a two to three stop advantage for the LX5 over the D300 with 17-50/2.8, at least when motion blur is not a problem.
